page.title: 13SOUTHSEA SHOPPING SURVEY
page.content: In order to find out some of the attitudes of people using{Palmerston {Road,}we prepared a questionnaire. We were put in four separate groups and posted at the corners of the Shopping precinct.Altogether 125 people were interviewed by us. After completing the survey we changed the results into percentages. 96% of people thought that it was a good idea that the road was a pedestrian precinct. 64% of people were satisfied with the variety of shops whilst 36% did not think there was an adequate variety. We asked the members of the public whether they considered prices in Palmerston Road to be higher than elsewhere. 36% of people thought they were ,whilst 64% thought they were no higher than elsewhere. Finally 80% of the people preferred Palmerston Road to Commercial Road in Portsmouth.
